content.description: Starts right of “Heat Wave.” A short crux around the third bolt leads to some big pockets. A final, committing sequence leads to easier climbing.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a chain anchor with lower off biners, shares the final two bolts and anchor with Heat Wave.
content.location: The farthest route to the right on the wall. The start is tricky and exposed, so a stick clip is recommended.

content.description: Start up “Fossil Fueled,” clipping its first bolt before immediately moving left, after which the line follows the thin orange streak between the two grey streaks. The crux is sequential with fairly large moves between pockets on poor feet. Stays fairly sustained until the last bolt, where you pass right around the intrepid little mahogany (it will probably have to come down eventually since the rope rubs it on TR). Cool rock with awesome features.
content.protection: 7 bolts to chain anchor with lower off biners.
content.location: The farthest route to the left on the wall.

content.description: Continuously thin, cryptic climbing leads to a small bulge. Pull through the bulge moving slightly right, then continue through easier climbing to the anchor.
content.protection: 7 bolts to chain anchor with lower off biners.
content.location: The third route from the left. A stick clip is recommended (or use the belay bolt).

content.description: Begin following a shallow, right facing corner up to a bulge. Pull the bulge using pockets and edges, and move through a lower angle, balance-y section above. Climb through a second bulge moving slightly right, then continue on easy ground to the anchor.
content.protection: 7 bolts to chain anchor with lower off biners.
content.location: The second route from the left. There is a belay bolt at the base.
